content: the pebble toque 1 the pebble toque photography by katrine maurer photography by kelly littlewood of peak & prairie knits created by peak & prairie knits the pebble toque 2 craft type knitting craft style toque/beanie skill level beginner/easy yarn any super bulky size 6 yarn i use lion brand wool-ease thick & quick other yarns used malabrigo rasta sugarbush chill weareknitters the wool see modifications section below if you wish to use a different yarn outside this list needles us 15/10mm 16 circular needles extras 1 stitch marker tapestry needle weaving ends scissors logo tag pom- pom abbreviations co cast on bobble bind off k knit p purl sm stitch marker st stitch sizing chart size # stitches to cast on # of row baby 0-3 months 29 23 baby 3-6 months 31 27 baby 6-12 months 33 30 toddler 35 32 child 39 34 teen 41 36 adult 43 38 adult + 45 40 created by peak & prairie knits the pebble toque 3 pattern refer to the sizing chart above to decide which size you are wishing to create 1 co number of st as listed in chart for your size example making the adult size you will co 43 st you may cast on in any way you feel comfortable i personally prefer the long-tail cast-on method 2 join st in the round you may wish to use a sm to help keep track of each bor row 1 k1 p1 row 2 p1 k1 repeat row 1 & 2 until you reach the number of row as listed in the chart for your size *be aware that whatever row you end on is not critical for the project as it is knit in seed stitch 3 after you finish knitting your final row as in the chart end at bor marker you can remove this marker cut a tail from your yarn approximately 16 and put on a tapestry needle transfer all your stitches onto this piece of yarn once all your stitches are on this yarn pull tight to for the top of the toque secure the yarn tightly to maintain shape to the top of the toque 4 embellish your toque as your see fit add your logo tags or pom-pom s to your completed toque modifications this pattern is really simple when you get the hang of it cast on is in un-even number of stitches to get the seam-less look of the toque you may wish to alter the length of the toque as you see fit feel free to alter the pattern as you see fit but please give credit design to the original designer myself kelly of peak & prairie knits please feel free to use this pattern to create stock for markets create a knitted item for a loved one or a fabulous little treat for yourself created by peak & prairie knits
